treatment.reference: Taxonomic description of Methanococcoides euhalobius and its transfer to the Methanohalophilus genus Ant van Leeuw 71:313-318
treatment.description: Irregular non-motile cocci, 1.0 to 2.5 µm diameter occurring single or in aggregates. Cells are sensitive to lysis by 0.01% of sodium dodecyl sulfate or TritonX–100 and exhibit a gram-negative reaction. Circular pale yellow colonies with entire margins are 1 mm in diameter after 14 days of growth. Methylamines and methanol are used for growth and methanogenesis. H2-CO2, formate and acetate are not used. The temperature range for growth is from 15 to 50˚C, the optimum temperature is 28–37˚C. The pH optimum is between 6.8 and 7.3. Growth occurs at the pH range from 5.8 to 8.0. Obligate moderate halophile, optimal growth in the presence of 1.0 M NaCl, the range of salinity tolerated is from0.16 to 2.3 M. Biotin, Ca2+ and Mg2+ are required for growth. Yeast extract stimulates growth, but it is not essential for growth. The G +C content of the DNA is 43.0 mol%. Habitat: mineralized stratal waters of oil deposits (Tataria, Russia). The type strain is strain 283 which was deposited in the Institute of Microbiology (Moscow, Russia).
